page.title: 11Housing in Stallingborough
page.content: Of the few pre war houses one cottage is 300 years old being modernised inside and in the original state on the exterior. The Hollies is 200 years old and is one of four properties without an inside toilet. Post war housing is made up of council houses, town houses but mainly semi and detached bungalows, one small estate of sixty dwellings consists of maisonettes, semi and detached two and three bedroomed bungalows. Anne Askew House is for older persons with a resident warden, it has seven one person bedsits and twentyone two person flats all rented. The small estate and all other houses are built off and alongside the main road. Planning is under discussion for three hundred dwellings.
